active_alerts.title: Bowdoin Escalator 125 (Lobby to street) is unavailable until further notice.
active_alerts.description:
The escalator will remain out of service for the foreseeable future. This decision was made after a thorough inspection determined that corrosion on the escalator’s steel truss was so severe that it could not be repaired further and that a complete replacement of the escalator would be required. Replacing the escalator at this location requires a more extended unit meeting modern escalator safety requirements. This longer unit will require significant alteration to the station entrance to meet code requirements. The MBTA has currently begun design work to understand what station upgrades will be needed. 
  
Due to these complexities, we expect the escalator will remain out of service for a significant time. We recognize the challenges this poses to our riders, and please know we are working to identify a solution as quickly as possible. In the meantime, Government Center Station, which is fully accessible and serves the Blue Line, is under a quarter-mile from Bowdoin Station.

There is no accessible path connecting the inb. & outb. platforms at Wellesley Sq Sta. The existing path includes steep slopes & is long.
active_alerts.description: There are accessible mini-high platforms at the Western end of both the Track 1 and Track 2 sides. However, the existing pedestrian path between the two sides is long and includes steep slopes, especially on the Crest Road bridge over the tracks. Designs are underway to provide for a fully compliant pathway.

active_alerts.description:
Additional Travel Time:
Riders should expect journey times to be 20 - 30 minutes longer than usual.

Free Bluebike Unlocks:
You can get five free Bluebike unlocks during this work by using the code MBTABLUE825, compliments of Bluebikes and the City of Boston.

active_alerts.title: Braintree Elev. 811 will be unavailable through Fri, Aug 22. Exit at Quincy Adams for a shuttle to Braintree.
active_alerts.description: A shuttle van is available to transport customers between Braintree and Quincy Adams. To exit, exit the train at Quincy Adams and find station personnel or use a station call box to request the shuttle bus to Braintree. To board, find station personnel or use a station call box at Braintree to request the shuttle van to Quincy Adams. Alternatively, customers may also use Bus Routes 230 and 236 for transportation between Braintree and Quincy Center.

active_alerts.title: Starting August 11th, outbound Fairmount trains 1615 & 1643 and inbound Train 1654 will be temporarily removed from the schedule.
active_alerts.description:
This schedule adjustment will allow Amtrak to continue to make emergency repairs following a fire at a signal bungalow caused by a downed Amtrak overhead wire on August 1. At the same time, the MBTA and Keolis will continue planned infrastructure improvements to prepare the Fairmount Line for battery-electric trains.

Schedule will be available on http://mbta.com/cr.

Affected trips:
1615 (8:17 am from South Station)
1643 (12:47 pm from South Station)
1654 (1:30 pm from Readville)

active_alerts.title: All inb. Franklin/Foxboro trains will bypass Forest Hills, Ruggles & Back Bay. After 9am, all Franklin Ln trains will terminate & originate
active_alerts.description:
Affected direction: Inbound

Inbound Franklin/Foxboro Line passengers traveling to Forest Hills, Ruggles, or Back Bay may:
- Transfer to a Providence Line train at Readville (Track 4)
- Stay on inbound Franklin/Foxboro train to South Station then transfer to an outbound train or the subway.

AFTER 9:00 A.M: 
Forge Park passengers should arrive 20 minutes earlier than the regularly scheduled train departure to take connecting shuttle bus service to Franklin Station for a connection with an inbound train for continued inbound service to South Station.

Mid-day Foxboro outb. trains 1725, 1731, 1739 & inb. trains 1732, 1740 & 1748 will be temporarily removed from the schedule. Passengers can
active_alerts.description:
This schedule adjustment will allow Amtrak to continue to make emergency repairs following a fire at a signal bungalow caused by a downed Amtrak overhead wire on August 1. At the same time, the MBTA and Keolis will begin construction of a permanent, accessible platform at Foxboro Station, while Amtrak repairs are underway.

The schedule changes will be in effect between the hours of 9:30 a.m. and 2:30 p.m. on weekdays, and updated schedules will be available soon. 

Inbound train 744 (the 1:20 p.m. from Franklin) will run via the Fairmount Line to provide service to affected passengers between Fairmount and South Station. 

Special event trains for concerts and Patriots games at Gillette Stadium will continue to operate during construction.

Affected trips:
1725 (8:43 am from South Station)
1731 (10:35 am from South Station)
1732 (10:36 am from Foxboro)
1739 (12:28 pm from South Station)
1740 (12:31 pm from Foxboro)
1748 (2:09 pm from Foxboro)
